• Improve the percentage of deliveries that we make at the agreed time.

services across networks.
Network Design
• Operational: Developed a network optimization tool to change our delivery areas to the depots every week so that capacity at every depot matches its demand and routing costs are minimized.
• Strategic: Use the network optimization tool to decide the number and location of new depots to support Coolblue’s future growth.
System development
• Development of new features of our route-planning tool: Multi-trip routing
• Link between operations and development: Ensure the proper running of our routing application by
troubleshooting feedback from operations and accordingly working with development for bug fixes.
Leadership

working.
• Stakeholder management: Key responsibility of my role entails managing internal and external stakeholders.  Build the quarterly roadmap for the team to align the senior management with team’s goals and projects.', 'title': 'Manager - Network & Route Planning ', 'employment_type': 'Full-time'}]}, {'company': {'id': 165790, 'name': 'Rotterdam School of Management, Erasmus University', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4E0BAQGxI95CurHtdA/company-logo_400_400/0/1657183585379?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=7q_IYkr6o65Kn3bcSIE-FIGmX3vREO1E0tghcy4E7Js', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/school/rotterdam-school-of-management-erasmus-university/', 'employees': {'start': 501, 'end': 1000}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}, 'end': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Rotterdam Area, Netherlands', 'date': {'start': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}, 'end': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}}, 'company': 'Rotterdam School of Management, Erasmus University', 'description': 'Online grocery has grown rapidly in different parts of the world over the last two decades. However, it is still not clear whether online grocery retailing can be profitable in the long run. Grocery retail is a low margin, high-cost business. Picking and delivering an online grocery order is labor intensive and costly. The delivery fee typically does not cover all the fulfilment costs. Many grocery retailers are making substantial investments to develop an online sales channel next to the traditional stores. With the emergence of omnichannel grocery retail, customers are provided with a seamless experience across online and offline channels. There are many synergies that exist between online and offline distribution, which if utilized properly can lead to significant cost savings to the retailer.', 'title': 'PhD Candidate', 'employment_type': 'Full-time'}]}, {'company': {'id': 15139718, 'name': 'Kuehne Logistics University', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C560BAQHVxryvSUUQWw/company-logo_400_400/0/1614696087390?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=k-WHRG2KMMlO1fpIwsiNrFWqZwspu-aiuvSxZ7krXYA', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/school/kuehne-logistics-university/', 'employees': {'start': 51, 'end': 200}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}, 'end': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Hamburg Area, Germany', 'date': {'start': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}, 'end': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}}, 'company': 'Kuehne Logistics University', 'description': 'Visited Prof. Dr. Jan Fransoo for our paper on "Towards Profitable Growth in E-Grocery Retailing - the Role of Store and Household Density". Our paper contributes to better understanding the interaction between the store channel and the e-grocery channel to identify under what conditions online grocery retailing can be profitable.  Therefore, we present a stylized model that allows one to study the cannibalization of sales between the e-grocery channel and the store channel. Thus, we model customer choice behavior across sales channels as well as its effects on operational fulfillment costs. In this model, we bring together different aspects that have previously been studied only in isolation. Second, we provide fundamental new insights into the drivers of the e-grocery channel's profitability and market share. Finally, we calibrate our model based on real-world industry data and thereby illuminate expected developments in the market shares of the different channels in various environments. We find that e-grocery channel profits increase with household density but decrease with store density. Picking costs also play a significant role in the profitability of the e-grocery channel. When the retailer's two channels are jointly optimized, e-grocery is a profitable option only when picking costs are low. In addition, we document that increases in customer valuations of the e-grocery channel can significantly boost its profitability. An increase in online sales will come at the expense of sales in the store channel, which jeopardizes that channel's financial viability. One possible outcome is the eventual closing of stores.', 'title': 'Visiting PHD Scholar', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': 3558, 'name': 'Georgia Institute of Technology', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4E0BAQFuhLQoh5_7yA/company-logo_400_400/0/1640110531895?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=CImysHMQ42OxOWZlRuQBkEIH-anR4lvRIdn4yDdxjUY', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/school/georgia-institute-of-technology/', 'employees': {'start': 5001, 'end': 10000}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}, 'end': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Atlanta, USA', 'date': {'start': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}, 'end': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}}, 'company': 'Georgia Institute of Technology', 'description': 'Worked with Prof. Dr. Martin Savelsbergh of the H. Milton Stewart School of Industrial and Systems Engineering on our paper "Optimizing Omni-Channel Fulfillment with Store Transfers".
Highlights:
We introduce a capacity sharing strategy in omni-channel retail distribution.
